revised_title: Atomic Heats of Rare-Earth Elements: Lanthanum, Cerium, Praseodymium, and Neodymium
tldr: The atomic heats of lanthanum, cerium, praseodymium, and neodymium were measured from 2 to 180 K. Lanthanum shows an anomaly corresponding to superconductivity at 4.37 K, while cerium, praseodymium, and neodymium exhibit anomalous behavior. The results suggest that the electronic states attributable to the 4f electrons are split by the electric fields within the metallic crystals, leading to complex interactions and anomalies in their atomic heats.
